Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the nature of the image by presenting it as a photo shot from space by a NASA satellite, when in reality it is a 3D virtual image created by a photographer using NASA satellite data.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the image is an actual photo taken by a NASA satellite.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image accurately represents the extent of the Australian bushfires, when in fact it is a visualization of the areas affected by the fires.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image is not a real photo but a visual representation based on data from NASA's FIRMS.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the expert that the image is a 3D virtual image created by a photographer using NASA satellite data.
